P.title: Will the Republican party's platform change significantly from 2020 to 2024?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Republican Party officially adopts a platform that reflects significant changes from its 2020 platform. Significant changes are defined as the inclusion of at least three major policy shifts or new policy positions that differ from the 2020 platform, as determined by a consensus of political analysts and commentators. The resolution will be based on the official platform released by the Republican National Committee (RNC) for the 2024 election cycle. In the absence of an official platform, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) that confirm such significant changes will suffice. Minor adjustments or updates to existing policies do not count as significant changes.

P.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Tucker Carlson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will his campaign raise over $10 million by the end of 2023?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means he is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the election day itself.

Then, will Tucker Carlson's campaign raise over $10 million by the end of 2023? For this, by December 31, 2023, Tucker Carlson's campaign must have officially reported raising over $10 million in total contributions, confirmed through a public disclosure report filed with the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or a reputable news source like BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, or Washington Post. The campaign must be actively fundraising and not in a state of suspension or closure, and contributions must be legal and from identifiable sources, excluding any funds raised through illegal means or from anonymous donations.

This is determined by the Republican National Convention selecting him as the nominee and his campaign officially reporting the fundraising amount through a public disclosure report filed with the FEC or a reputable news source, with the campaign actively fundraising and contributions being legal and from identifiable sources.

Then, is it true that by June 30, 2024, a reputable polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos, etc.) will report that Tucker Carlson's approval ratings among registered Republican voters exceed 50%? The polling data must be based on a sample size of at least 1,000 respondents and conducted within the month preceding the resolution date. The approval rating must be explicitly stated as a percentage in the poll results. In the event of conflicting polls, the resolution will be based on the poll conducted closest to the resolution date that meets these criteria. Polls that do not specify the approval rating among Republican voters will not be considered.

P.title: Will Donald Trump face legal challenges that affect his candidacy for the 2024 election?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by November 5, 2024, Donald Trump faces legal challenges that result in any of the following outcomes that affect his ability to run for President in the 2024 election:
1. A felony conviction that disqualifies him from running for office under the 14th Amendment, Section 3.
2. A court ruling that prohibits him from appearing on the ballot in any state.
3. A significant legal action (such as an indictment) that leads to a substantial media narrative or public perception that he is unable to effectively campaign or serve if elected.

Legal challenges must be confirmed by credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If he is found not guilty or the charges are dropped after the resolution date, it will not affect the outcome of this question.

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
Q.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

R.title: Will the Republican Party's support for Donald Trump increase or decrease leading up to the 2024 election?
R.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by November 5, 2024, polls and surveys conducted by reputable organizations (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos) indicate that at least 60% of registered Republican voters express support for Donald Trump as their preferred candidate for the Republican nomination for the 2024 presidential election. Support must be measured in a standardized manner, and the question will resolve as No if the percentage falls below 60%. The resolution will also consider endorsements from major Republican figures or organizations that indicate a significant increase in support for Trump. In case of conflicting data, the average of the last three reputable polls conducted before the election will be used to determine the outcome.
